title: Ticket #2386: Add file transfer to BOSCO
description:
BOSCO needs to support file transfer.

The work for this ticket lives on V7_9-bosco_file_xfer-publicbranch in git.

Milestones

  • [2 days] Become familiar with relevant pre-existing file-transfer code [Zach]
  • [3 days] Add send/receive sandbox handlers to transferd [Zach]
  • [5 days] Write sandbox management gahp [Zach]
  • Modify gridmanager [Jaime]
    • [2 days] Add transferd management code (using existing code in the schedd as a template)
    • [2 days] Add handlers for new gahp commands
    • [5 days] Add sandbox movement to pbs/lsf job workflow, with particular attention paid to proper recovery
  • [4 days] Testing [Zach]

History

Design considerations

These are the design considerations, in approximate order of importance. They will guide the approach we decide to take. Many of these are preferences, not requirements. 'A' is the initial submit machine. 'B' is the PBS/LSF frontend node.

  • No reverse connections (B to A)
  • No security setup beyond ssh authentication
  • Minimize amount of new code
  • At least same level of service as Condor-C -> blahp
    • Currently, Condor-C -> blahp transfers back all input and output files if TransferOutputFiles isn't set. Do we want to improve this?
  • No independent, long-lived processes on B
    • Either short-lived or tied to ssh connection
  • Avoid secondary connections (A to B)
  • Avoid additional software installation on B (none as root)
  • Avoid additional software installation on A (none as root)
  • Avoid use of extra ports on B for incoming connections
  • Avoid connection per file transfer

Design Choices

Fuse Mount FS of B on A

  • Modify gridmanager to copy files around (4 days)
  • Modify gridmanager to create fuse mount (3 days)
  • Modify FileTransfer to provide lists of source and destination paths (2 days)
  • Requires kernel module on A; on most distros it is as easy as installing a package, but unfortunately that package is not typically installed by default.
  • Easier to add support to bring back changed files
  • Use one connection to transfer all files

Scp Files From A to B

  • Modify gridmanager to scp files around (6 days)
  • Modify FileTransfer to provide lists of source and destination paths (2 days)
  • Uses new connection per transfer
  • Cumbersome to avoid transferring unmodified input files, and/or transferring back changed/created files (need to ssh ls, then scp).

Invoke FileTransfer-based tool on B

  • Modify gridmanager to launch tool and use FileTransfer with it (5 days)
  • Write file transfer tool (5 days)
  • Requires extra port on B (with security) or uses new connection per transfer or handles multiple requests over stdin/stdout
  • FileTransfer already handles most details
  • Tool would require Condor config file or have extra modifications to not require it

Add file transfer commands to blahp

  • Modify gridmanager to do file transfers via blahp (5 days)
  • Add file transfer commands to blahp (5 days)
  • Can't parallelize large file transfers with other activities
  • Currently pipe to a gahp is a command channel; this would confuse the role of this communication channel from command only to command and/or data... probably not a good idea.
